page.title: 12FAMILY SURVEY
page.content: THE TOWN OF{CORRINGHAM}IS A FAIRLY NEW TOWN.MOST OF THE HOUSES AND AMENITIES HAVE BEEN BUILT SINCE THE 1950'S.OUR CLASS DID A SURVEY TO FIND OUT{WHERE {OUR PARENTS WERE BORN}AND WHERE THEY LIVED.WE FOUND MANY CAME FROM THE{EAST {END OF LONDON. PEOPLE WERE MOVING OUT OF LONDON'S EAST END TO PLACES LIKE{CORRINGHAM}AND STANFORD FOR QUITE A FEW THINGS.FIRST OF ALL THE HOUSES WERE A BIT SHABBY AND DURING THE II WORLD WAR A LOT OF PEOPLE WERE BOMBED OUT OF HOMES.THEY NEEDED SOMEWHERE TO LIVE,SO WHY NOT MOVE INTO THE COUNTRYSIDE INTO A NEW TOWN.THERE WERE ALSO A LOT OF{JOBS AVAILABLE WITH{TILBURY DOCKS}AND THE HUGE{OIL REFINERIES}AT{CORYTON.}ALSO THEY WERE KNOCKING DOWN HOUSES TO BUILD FLATS AND THE CITY BECAME COMPRESSED LIKE A TIN OF SARDINES AS THE POPULATION OF ENGLAND INCREASED.
